name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: One of the big issues with rules about how ministers' are meant to behave is proliferation of politics being done by text and whatsapp - whatever happened in this case, the rules don't really cover the reality of how people communicate now

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: And of course, Treasury set precedent a few weeks ago when they published Sunak's texts to David Cameron about Greensill - we have asked No 10 if they will do the same with Johnson's texts to Dyson

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: I'm told Sunak did not and has never had any personal contact with Sir James Dyson

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: I understand No 11 was uneasy about what Dyson was asking for, and it's suggested they had quite deliberately not responded to his firm's requests before Sir James himself then texted Johnson directly about the tax issue

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Civil Service Management Code suggests ultimately, decisions about signing off any of these kinds of conflicts, are down to Permanent Secretaries - in this case, it would have been John Manzoni, who was in charge at Cabinet Office at the time

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Full text of his letter also here -  https://t.co/0r8VNmdn8i

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Bill Crothers says in his letter, also published, that his job 'was seen as a way of me transitioning back into the private sector and was supported by the Cabinet Office leadership. This advisory role was not seen as contentious, and I believe not uncommon.'

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: It is one thing for former politicians and former officials to wriggle around at the edge of the rules that are meant to make sure there are no conflicts of interest, and no cronyism - another for people still in senior jobs to start working for commercial outfits

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Cabinet Office explanation in reply letter to ACOBA says Crothers started working for the failed bank in September 2015, then left govt in Nov 15, and role was cleared under Cabinet Office conflict of interest policy

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: So, a very senior civil servant who was making commercial decisions about procurement, started working for Greensill even before he left Whitehall

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Letter from ACOBA, lobbying watchdog, reveals civil servant joined Greensill board while he was STILL working in government  https://t.co/Kh4by6UbHl

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: 3 govt ministers, including Health Sec, could face Qs on this in Commons today- don't be surprised if they refer to this review - extraordinary in theory that PM asked for investigation into a predecessor, but gives current ministers a temporary answer too ...

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: ‚ÄòClassic, casual Cameron‚Äô - what‚Äôs this review really designed to do?   https://t.co/vVDWUoHwfL

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: In other news.... @adamfleming  went to the pub so you didn't have to #newscast  https://t.co/EcdbtM5J3t

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: But the review allows ministers who might be asked tricky questions about what they knew to say, 'ah this is all being looked at'

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: If anyone was expecting a chunky review that would come up with a much tougher regime, think again

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Review doesn't have any legal powers, and not expected to come up with recommendations for tightening up the system

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: here's the official announcement

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Review will report by end of June 2021

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Cabinet Office spokesperson confirms 'A Review into the Development and Use of Supply Chain Finance (and associated schemes) related to Greensill Capital in Government' has been commissioned by the PM - confirms Nigel Boardman will step back from his BEIS role for now

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Understand that Nigel Boardman will step back from his responsibilities as non-exec member of BEIS board for a bit, while he carries out investigation into Cameron + Greensill

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: No sign of Labour letting up on Greensill despite  investigation - Rachel Reeves tells PLP, 'what govt is doing is completely inadequate' 'this may be a 'Whatsapp from Matt Hancock's public landlord' times a million, but it's part of the same catalogue of appalling behaviour'

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: For all of Westminster's cacophony, people listened when Williams spoke - and I'll remember her being unfailingly kind and generous to young reporters, as green as grass,  for whom SW1 was an alien land

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Ed Davey-"Political life will be poorer without her intellect, her wisdom and her generosity.  Shirley had a limitless empathy only too rare in politics today; she connected with people, cared about their lives and saw politics as a crucial tool to change lives for the better"

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: She was a groundbreaking politician - MP in the 1960s Labour Cabinet minister in the 1970s, co-founder of the SDP in 1980s, then Liberal Democrat peer in later life

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Sad news - Shirley Williams, Baroness Williams of Crosby, has died aged 90

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Commons tributes to the Duke of Edinburgh getting underway - on @BBCNews now

name: Laura Kuenssberg
tweet: Investigation will be carried out by Nigel Boardman, a senior lawyer - he is also a non-exec director on the board of the BEIS department - not clear yet if he will stand aside from that while he carries out inquiry
